intro: Tittmannia scapigera, commonly known as the scapigerous tittmannia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Tittmannia scapigera is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
